alert.note: Alert for Denver; Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 10:22PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Denver and Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1022 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bear Creek, Clear Creek, Dutch Creek and Turkey Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southwestern Denver, Lakewood, western Englewood, southwestern Wheat Ridge, eastern Golden, Sheridan and Pleasant View.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
